title: recipes_Pan_Fried_Whole_Trout
text:
Title: Pan Fried Whole Trout.
.
Description: There couldn't be a better way to prepare freshly caught wild brook trout. Serve with a side of creamy mashed potatoes and steamed Swiss chard..
.
Ingredients:.
- 4 whole (12 ounce) trout, cleaned with tails and heads on.
- 0.5 cup all-purpose flour.
- 0.5 cup cornmeal.
- 0.125 teaspoon cayenne pepper.
- 1 teaspoon salt.
- 1 teaspoon ground black pepper.
- 3 tablespoons olive oil.
- 2 lemons - cut into wedges, for garnish.
.
Instructions:.
- Remove gills from fish and discard. Rinse fish under cold water..
- In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat..
- In shallow dish, combine the flour, cornmeal, salt and pepper. Raise heat to high. Dredge fish in flour mixture and fry in hot oil for about 4 to 6 minutes on each side or until meat flakes with a fork. Serve garnished with lemon wedges..
.
Nutrients:.
calories: 711 kcal.
carbohydrateContent: 30 g.
cholesterolContent: 195 mg.
fiberContent: 4 g.
proteinContent: 73 g.
saturatedFatContent: 5 g.
sodiumContent: 764 mg.
sugarContent: 0 g.
fatContent: 33 g.
unsaturatedFatContent: 0 g.
.
Serves: 4 servings.
